The CDC: s website does have a paragraph that mentions a positive test result for COVID-19 could indicate previous infection with other coronaviruses that cause the common cold or flu.
The screenshot used in the Facebook post: s website under the topic "Test for Past Infection (Antibody Test)."
Health experts: including Kenyan doctor Githinji Gitahi, have clarified that the social media posts misinterpreted the paragraph and that there are two types of tests for COVID-19 - the viral test and the antibody test.
The viral test: conducted in the nose, throat, or lungs, detects the SARS-CoV-2 virus specifically and does not produce a positive result for COVID-19 from traces of other human coronaviruses. The antibody test, which checks for antibodies in the blood, is not specific to SARS-CoV-2 and may yield positive results for other coronaviruses as well.
